![Jangsado Sea Park (Ïû•ÏÇ¨ÎèÑ Ìï¥ÏÉÅÍ≥µÏõê)](/2022-12-20-1671521765502/2369487_image2_1.webp) ## Overview > Located in Hansan-myeon, Tongyeong-si, Gyeongsangnam-do, Jangsado Island is an island that is just 400 meters in x_width, and 1.9 kilometers in length, reaching an altitude of 108 meters with a total area of 390,131„é°. The island has approximately 100,000 trees, with numerous camellia trees and other varieties including silver magnolia. It also a home to beautiful fairy pitta birds, a natural monument, in addition to white eye birds. Local plants that represent Jangsado Island include aerides and dendrobium monile. The island‚Äôs name was previously Jamsado Island, derived from its long shape that resembles a silkworm (‚Äújam‚Äù is a Chinese character that means ‚Äúsilkworm‚Äù). However, due to a translation error during the Japanese colonization, the name was changed to Jangsado Island.

Jangsado Island is beautiful year round, with hydrangeas blanketing the island in summer and camellias blooming in winter. In order to preserve the natural beauty, urbanization on the island is limited. The eco-friendly park has various sculptures and artistic pieces, and holds various performances take place at the outdoor performance hall which can accommodate up to 1,000 guests. ## Intro | | | | - | - | |infocenter:|‚Ä¢ 1330 Travel Hotline: +82-2-1330
(Korean, English, Japanese, Chinese)
‚Ä¢ For more info: +82-55-633-0362| |parking:|Not available| |restdate:|The day before and the day of Seollal (Lunar New Year‚Äôs Day)
* May be temporarily closed when ferries cannot operate due to adverse weather conditions| |usetime:|April-September 08:00-19:00
October-March 08:30-17:00
* Last admission is 2 hours before closing.| ## Detail Info | | | | - | - | |Shopping Information:|Restaurant, snack bar, cafeteria| |Film Locations:|Dramas "My Love From the Stars 2013," "One Warm Word (2013)," "Uncontrollably Fond (2016)"
Variety show "Running Man"| |Admission Fees:|Individuals - Adults 10,500 won / Teenagers 8,000 won / Children 5,000 won
Groups - Teenagers 6,000 won / Children 4,500 won

* Teenagers (middle-high school students) / Children (ages 3-elementary school students)
* Groups: 30 or more people
* No group discount available for adults
* ID card or proof of age is required for discounted rates| |Facility Utilization Fees:|[Ottchil Art Museum] Free entrance| |Available Facilities:|[Convenience facilities] Observatory, walking path, potted plant garden, caf√©, restaurant, snack bar, vending machine
[Sanitary facilities] Restroom, water purifying facility
[Special facilities] Bare foot garden (ice foot bath ‚Äì operates only in summer)
[Cultural facilities] Ottchil Art Museum, outdoor gallery (sculptures)| |Restrooms:|Available | |Interpretation Services Offered:|Guidebooks in English and Chinese| ## Detail Image ![/2022-12-20-1671521765502/1733560_image2_1.webp](/2022-12-20-1671521765502/1733560_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-12-20-1671521765502/2369477_image2_1.webp](/2022-12-20-1671521765502/2369477_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-12-20-1671521765502/2369480_image2_1.webp](/2022-12-20-1671521765502/2369480_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-12-20-1671521765502/2369481_image2_1.webp](/2022-12-20-1671521765502/2369481_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-12-20-1671521765502/2369485_image2_1.webp](/2022-12-20-1671521765502/2369485_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-12-20-1671521765502/2369489_image2_1.webp](/2022-12-20-1671521765502/2369489_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-12-20-1671521765502/2369490_image2_1.webp](/2022-12-20-1671521765502/2369490_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-12-20-1671521765502/2369492_image2_1.webp](/2022-12-20-1671521765502/2369492_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-12-20-1671521765502/2369494_image2_1.webp](/2022-12-20-1671521765502/2369494_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-12-20-1671521765502/1733550_image2_1.webp](/2022-12-20-1671521765502/1733550_image2_1.webp) ## Contact - [‚òéÔ∏è+82-55-633-0362](tel:+82556330362) - [üè†www.jangsado.co.kr](http://www.jangsado.co.kr/) ```googleMap latitude: 34.7137492807 longitude: 128.5588971305 title: 55, Jangsado-gil, Tongyeong-si, Gyeongsangnam-do ``` ## Directions [Bus]
From Seoul Nambu Terminal, take a bus to Gohyeon Bus Terminal.
Walk for approx. 145m toward Geoje Children Hospital Bus Stop and take Bus No. 52 and get off at Gabae Bus Stop.
Walk toward Jangsado Ferry Terminal for approx. 2 min and take a ferry to the park.

data.title: Jangsado Sea Park (Ïû•ÏÇ¨ÎèÑ Ìï¥ÏÉÅÍ≥µÏõê)
data.description:
Located in Hansan-myeon, Tongyeong-si, Gyeongsangnam-do, Jangsado Island is an island that is just 400 meters in x_width, and 1.9 kilometers in length, reaching an altitude of 108 meters with a total area of 390,131„é°. The island has approximately 100,000 trees, with numerous camellia trees and other varieties including silver magnolia. It also a home to beautiful fairy pitta birds, a natural monument, in addition to white eye birds. Local plants that represent Jangsado Island include aerides and dendrobium monile. The island‚Äôs name was previously Jamsado Island, derived from its long shape that resembles a silkworm (‚Äújam‚Äù is a Chinese character that means ‚Äúsilkworm‚Äù). However, due to a translation error during the Japanese colonization, the name was changed to Jangsado Island.

Jangsado Island is beautiful year round, with hydrangeas blanketing the island in summer and camellias blooming in winter. In order to preserve the natural beauty, urbanization on the island is limited. The eco-friendly park has various sculptures and artistic pieces, and holds various performances take place at the outdoor performance hall which can accommodate up to 1,000 guests.
data.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Jinhae NFRDI Environment Eco-Park (ÏßÑÌï¥ÎÇ¥ÏàòÎ©¥ ÌôòÍ≤ΩÏÉùÌÉúÍ≥µÏõê)
dataList.description: Jinhae NFRDI Environment Eco-Park (Inland Water Eco Park) is located nearby the Nambu Inland Water Research Center with an area of 83,897„é° which serves as a habitat to diverse organisms. This environmentally friendly park boasts a splendid natural landscape with over 65 different species of trees (sheepberry, willow, boxwood, cherry blossom trees, etc.) and abundant flowers (golden reed, hosta, water canna, irises, etc.). The park is open to the public and is a favorite retreat for residents of the area.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Jeodo Island (Ï†ÄÎèÑ(Îî±ÏÑ¨))
dataList.description:
Jeodo Island derives its name from the abundance of paper mulberry (a fiber crop largely used for papermaking) growing on the island. The letter jeo refers to paper mulberry, while -do refers to island.

On Jeodo Island, one can get a glimpse of what daily life in a small fishing village is like. The island can also be seen just behind the bamboo weirs from Siran Dock. The view is a combination of a lighthouse, fishing site, lush meadows, and lodgings with the ocean in the background. Fishing using bamboo weirs is a rare sight to see in Korea, and can only be found on the southern coast.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Jehwangsan Park (Ï†úÌô©ÏÇ∞Í≥µÏõê)
dataList.description:
Jehwangsan Park, located on Jehwangsan Mountain at the heart of Jinhae, is home to the nine-story Jinhae Tower. The tower, which symbolizes a Korean naval warship, stands at the top of a 365-step staircase and commands a splendid view of both the city and the coastline. On the first and second floors of the tower is the Jinhae City Museum, exhibiting folk models and relics excavated from Jinhae.

Jinhae is Korea‚Äôs representative naval port city and is rife with cultural relics related to Admiral Yi Sun-Sin (1545-1598), a Korean hero who led the nation to victory in naval battles against Japanese forces during the Imjin War (1592-1598). The city is also known as the venue of the famous Jinhae Gunhangje Festival, which is widely known as the nation‚Äôs largest cherry blossom festival.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Jangyu Daecheonggyegok Valley (Ïû•Ïú†ÎåÄÏ≤≠Í≥ÑÍ≥°)
dataList.description:
The 6-kilometer-long Jangyu Daecheonggyegok Valley is located at the foot of Bulmosan Mountain, where the water flowing into the valley divides into two principal streams. Lush trees and clean water make up the area‚Äôs beautiful natural landscape. A 30-minute hike along the valley will take hikers to Jangyuam Hermitage where they will find the stupa of Jangyuhwasang, who is said to have spread Buddhism for the first time in Korea.

Visitors flock to Jangyu Daecheonggyegok Valley not only to enjoy the scenery, but also to taste the delicious duck, chicken, and baeksuk (chicken soup with rice) dishes sold around the area. In 1984, the valley was integrated into Jangyupokpo Recreational Park where bridges were built and water supply facilities were placed at two locations. Sangjeolgyo Bridge at the entrance to the valley is 30 meters, while Bonpogyo Bridge is 4 meters. A 1,720 meter-long forest trail was also created. The rugged mountain terrain offers a challenging, yet highly interesting climb up the mountain.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Jangboksan Sculpture Park (Ïû•Î≥µÏÇ∞Ï°∞Í∞ÅÍ≥µÏõê)
dataList.description:
Jangboksan Sculpture Park stands as the unofficial gateway to Jinhae at the end of Jangbok-ro Road between Masan and Jinhae. Built in 1979 in the wake of a mountain landslide, the park offers a panoramic view of Jinhae and its quiet waters. In spring, more than ten thousand cherry trees interspersed throughout the pines come to full bloom, permeating the air with their sweet fragrance.

Nearby attractions include Daegwangsa and Jinheungsa Temples, the Citizens’ Hall, the Gyeongnam Literary Hall, and Jinhae Park Land, located halfway up Jangboksan Mountain. To visit these attractions and explore the beauty of the forest, simply follow the walking trail from Jinhae Girls’ High School to the park (1.5 kilometers) and continue walking along the path from the Jangboksan Rest Area to Gumajin Tunnel (1 kilometer).
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Jaeyaksan Mountain (Ïû¨ÏïΩÏÇ∞)
dataList.description: Situated between Miryang and Ulju, Jaeyaksan Mountain (1,119.1 meters) boasts gorgeous landscapes with giant rock formations near its peak. One of the most popular attractions of the mountain is Sajapyeong Plain and its vast field of silvergrass. The hiking course is relatively easy, adding to its charm. Nearby attractions include Eoreumgol Valley, Hobakso Pool, Pyochungsa Temple, Cheungcheungpokpo Falls, and Geumgangpokpo Falls.
dataList.author: korea-tour
